spanishExample: Deseo tener un tenedor enseguida.
englishTranslation: I wish to have a fork immediately.
vocabIncluded: deseo: wish, I wish (Desear, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Ha jurado que no desea absolutamente nada.
englishTranslation: She has sworn that she doesn’t wish for absolutely anything.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
desea: wishes, he/she/it wishes (Desear, present, 3rd person)
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Corrí para conseguir las llaves, porque prometieron dármelas.
englishTranslation: I ran to get the keys, because they promised to give them to me.
vocabIncluded: corrí: ran, I ran (Correr, preterite, 1st person)
para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive
prometieron: promised, they promised (Prometer, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: ¿Me prometes que no jugarás con él? Está corriendo y no tiene tiempo.
englishTranslation: Do you promise me you won’t play with him? He’s running and doesn’t have time.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
prometes: promise, you promise (Prometer, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Juramos que la computadora no funcionaba.
englishTranslation: We swore the computer didn’t work.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
juramos: swore/vowed, we swore/vowed (Jurar, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Juraste que llegarías temprano, mira tu reloj.
englishTranslation: You swore you would arrive early, look at your watch.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
juraste: swore/vowed, you swore/vowed (Jurar, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Prometimos no correr antes del desayuno.
englishTranslation: We promised not to run before breakfast.
vocabIncluded: del: "of the" before a masculine noun
prometimos: promised, we promised (Prometer, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: No quiere que yo lo desee.
englishTranslation: She doesn’t want me to wish for it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
desee: wish, I wish (Desear, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Ella ha deseado una computadora y yo juré que la compraría.
englishTranslation: She has wished for a computer and I swore I would buy it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
juré: swore/vowed, I swore/vowed (Jurar, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Me consiguió un reloj para que yo corra muchísimo.
englishTranslation: He got me a wristwatch in order for me to run a whole lot.
vocabIncluded: consiguió: acquired/got, he/she/it acquired/got (Conseguir, preterite, 3rd person)
corra: run, I run (Correr, subjunctive, 1st person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: Tienes que jurar que no sabes nada de este objeto.
englishTranslation: You have to swear that you don’t know anything about this object.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Juraron que irían a la cena con su abuelita.
englishTranslation: They swore they would go to dinner with their granny.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
irían: "would go", "they would go" (Ir, conditional, 3rd person plural)
juraron: swore/vowed, they swore/vowed (Jurar, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Juro que no sé dónde están los platos.
englishTranslation: I swear I don’t know where the plates are.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
dónde: adverb meaning "where?" in a question or implied question
juro: swear/vow, I swear/vow (Jurar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Desearía poder tener un gato; ojalá algún día.
englishTranslation: I would wish to be able to have a cat; hopefully someday.
vocabIncluded: desearía: would wish, I would wish (Desear, conditional, 1st person)

spanishExample: Prometo que la cerradura está definitivamente funcionando.
englishTranslation: I promise that the lock is definitely working.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
prometo: promise, I promise (Prometer, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Juramos que hay un cuchillo y un tenedor para el almuerzo.
englishTranslation: We swear that there is a knife and a fork for lunch.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)
juramos: swear/vow, we swear/vow (Jurar, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Tienes que prometer que no harás que corran.
englishTranslation: You have to promise that you won’t make them run.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
corran: run, they run (Correr, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)
harás: "will do/make", "you will do/make" (Hacer, future, 2nd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Siempre promete que llegará a tiempo, pero siempre tiene prisa.
englishTranslation: She always promises that she’ll arrive on time, but she is always in a rush.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
promete: promises, he/she/it promises (Prometer, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Está deseando que la cerradura funcione.
englishTranslation: He’s wishing for the lock to work.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
funcione: function/work, he/she/it function/work (Funcionar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Siempre corremos después del almuerzo y antes de la cena.
englishTranslation: We always run after lunch and before dinner.
vocabIncluded: corremos: run, we run (Correr, present, 1st person plural)
del: "of the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: Quiero que desee algo mejor.
englishTranslation: I want him to wish for something better.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
desee: wish, he/she/it wish (Desear, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Tendrás este objeto contigo cuando corras.
englishTranslation: You’ll have this object with you when you run.
vocabIncluded: corras: run, you run (Correr, subjunctive, 2nd person)
tendrás: "will have", "you will have" (Tener, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No ha prometido eso, aun cuando es importante.
englishTranslation: She hasn’t promised that, even when it’s important.
vocabIncluded: ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¡No corras dentro de la casa! Prométeme que no lo harás.
englishTranslation: Don’t run inside the house! Promise me you won’t do it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
dentro: inside (adverb often used with de)
harás: "will do/make", "you will do/make" (Hacer, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Ella desearía tener un vaso y una cuchara.
englishTranslation: She would wish to have a glass and a spoon.
vocabIncluded: desearía: would wish, he/she/it would wish (Desear, conditional, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Deseamos correr como ellos corren.
englishTranslation: We wished to run like they run.
vocabIncluded: corren: run, they run (Correr, present, 3rd person plural)
deseamos: wished, we wished (Desear, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Deseaba algo completamente nuevo.
englishTranslation: I was wishing for something completely new.
vocabIncluded: deseaba: wished, I wished (Desear, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: La llave estaba totalmente bien, pero él jura que no lo estaba.
englishTranslation: The key was totally fine, but he swears it wasn't.
vocabIncluded: "bien": adverb meaning "well", "fine", and a variety of other positive things
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
jura: swears/vows, he/she/it swears/vows (Jurar, present, 3rd person)
lo: "that way", "like that", constructed like a direct object (esp with Ser and Estar)

spanishExample: Deseaba ir a la carrera, pero no corrió.
englishTranslation: She was wishing to go to the race, but she didn’t run.
vocabIncluded: corrió: ran, he/she/it ran (Correr, preterite, 3rd person)
deseaba: wished, he/she/it wished (Desear, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¿Corres todos los días? // Yo nunca corro.
englishTranslation: Do you run every day? // I never run.
vocabIncluded: corres: run, you run (Correr, present, 2nd person)
corro: run, I run (Correr, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Juran que si ella corre, va a ganar.
englishTranslation: They swear that if she runs, she is going to win.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
corre: runs, he/she/it runs (Correr, present, 3rd person)
juran: swear/vow, they swear/vow (Jurar, present, 3rd person plural)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Promete que nos veremos en el desayuno.
englishTranslation: Promise that we’ll see each other at breakfast.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
veremos: will see, we will see (Ver, future, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Obviamente no hiciste lo que prometiste.
englishTranslation: Obviously you didn’t do what you promised.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
prometiste: promised, you promised (Prometer, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Prometí darte lo que deseas.
englishTranslation: I promised to give you what you wish for.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
deseas: wish, you wish (Desear, present, 2nd person)
prometí: promised, I promised (Prometer, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Juró que la cuchara y el cuchillo estaban detrás de los vasos.
englishTranslation: He swore that the spoon and the knife were behind the glasses.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
detrás: behind/in the back (adverb often used with de)
juró: swore/vowed, he/she/it swore/vowed (Jurar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Últimamente, deseamos que ella corra más.
englishTranslation: Lately, we wish for her to run more.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
corra: run, he/she/it run (Correr, subjunctive, 3rd person)
deseamos: wish, we wish (Desear, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: ¡Corra! ¡Debe darse prisa!
englishTranslation: (Formal) Run! You must hurry!
vocabIncluded: debe: must, he/she/it must (Deber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¿Juras que eso es lo que desean?
englishTranslation: Do you swear that that’s what they wish for?
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
desean: wish, they wish (Desear, present, 3rd person plural)
juras: swear/vow, you swear/vow (Jurar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¡Corre! No hay tiempo para nada.
englishTranslation: Run! There isn’t time for anything.
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)
